image.altText: Two police officers

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan promises to "jolt the system" by banning machetes and enacting tougher bail laws for both young and adult offenders in the face of growing crime rates.

title.children: Victoria launches dramatic legal reforms to fight rising crime

image.altText: A kangaroo hops across a street in a small town.

props.synopsis: A $29 million boost to relief for businesses and farmers affected by the Grampians bushfires has come after calls for better support.

title.children: Funding promised for bushfire-affected Grampians businesses doing it tough

image.altText: Drone image of Wharton Beach, where the shark attack took place.

props.synopsis: Authorities have not been able to recover the body of surfer Steven Jeffrey Payne after he was fatally attacked by a shark at Wharton Beach, near Esperance on Monday.

title.children: Melbourne surfer in fatal shark attack at WA beach identified

image.altText: Man wearing a beanie smiles.

props.synopsis: Glenn Ernest Fenwick, 61, was jailed for a maximum of five and a half years after pleading guilty to the manslaughter of Christopher Jarvis, with the judge labelling the killing "brutal, unlawful and dangerous conduct".

title.children: 'This will seem a paltry sentence': Man jailed for 2006 cold case killing

image.altText: A person in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will explore raising the threshold for granting bail for serious crimes in an effort to quell public concerns about safety.

title.children: Debate rages inside Allan government around bail laws as crime soars

image.altText: Lino Atem wears a basketball top and looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Nine teenagers are among those arrested after 24-year-old Lino Atem was killed in what police allege was a "ferocious" and "targeted" ambush at a park in Melbourne's south-west.

title.children: Police arrest 13 people over stabbing death of Lino Atem

image.altText: A young, fair-haired man with a neat beard lies in bed. His nose is swollen and his face is bruised.

props.synopsis: A solicitor who was bashed in his home town says he was thinking "this could be it" as he was kicked and punched by a gang of young men.

title.children: Young lawyer haunted by savage bashing in Bendigo

image.altText: A wind turbine, as seen from close proximity, towering above bushland where other turbines stand.

props.synopsis: Residents in the south-west Victorian town of Nelson say building the some of the biggest wind turbines in Australia will harm the look and environment of the picturesque area.

title.children: 270m-high wind turbine plan generates opposition in Victorian town

image.altText: Smiling Indian woman in front of white and pink wall of flowers, wears pink and white saree, pearl and silver necklace, earings.

props.synopsis: One year after Point Cook mother Chaithanya Madhagani's body was found in a wheelie bin, her friends are still waiting for answers.

title.children: 'What are the police doing?': Questions over Melbourne mum's death

image.altText: Zion Williamson during a game for the New Orleans Pelicans

props.synopsis: The New Orleans Pelicans will play Melbourne United and South East Melbourne Phoenix in historic NBA pre-season fixtures in the Victorian capital.

title.children: New Orleans Pelicans to become first NBA team to play in Australia

image.altText: A man reading a book at an office desk

props.synopsis: Victoria's Information Commissioner Sean Morrison says the state's entire FOI system is "no longer fit for purpose" and is in urgent need of an overhaul.

title.children: Want to access your own health records in Victoria? It could take months

image.altText: Swans fans wave red and white flags at a Sydney game at the SCG

props.synopsis: The AFL's Opening Round is pitched as a way to celebrate and evolve a truly national competition, but there is really only one winner from this increasingly unpopular weekend — the AFL itself.

title.children: The AFL, 'Vic bias' and the flawed logic behind Opening Round

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield of the Cats leads his team out onto the field.

props.synopsis: Multiple AFL clubs will face scheduled audits in 2025, as veteran journalist Caroline Wilson reported the league is looking into third party payments at Geelong Football Club.

title.children: 'You don’t want to mess with the salary cap': Clubs audited by AFL

image.altText: Departures entrance to Avalon Airport, near Geelong, Victoria.

props.synopsis: A teenager who allegedly boarded a Jetstar flight armed with a shotgun has triggered a review of security at airports around Australia.

title.children: Security breach at Avalon Airport triggers national crackdown

image.altText: Jemimah with her husband Liam and daughter Billie

props.synopsis: Secondary infertility is often unexpected, and the physical, emotional, and financial impacts can be just as distressing as primary infertility.

title.children: 'I did it once, why can't I do it again?' The pain of secondary infertility

image.altText: A blurry still shot of a white glowing ball in a partly cloudy night sky with an orange tail burning behind it.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have reported what is believed to be burning space junk moving across southern Australian skies on Saturday night.

title.children: Meteor group 'flooded' with reports of space junk over Victoria, NSW

image.altText: Two Chinese dragons, one with a white head and another with a black, in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: High temperatures in Melbourne have failed to keep crowds away from the colour and celebrations of the annual Moomba Festival.

title.children: First Wurundjeri float at Moomba, as thousands brave sweltering temps

image.altText: Dave Hughes

props.synopsis: Dave Hughes based his comedy career on the embarrassing moments of his life. Now he's ready to talk about the terrifying ones.

title.children: When Dave Hughes gave up alcohol, he swapped one problem for another

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair sits on a park bench. She is smiling wearing a black short-sleeved shirt.

props.synopsis: Australian businesses in the clean energy sector are being urged to shake up their recruitment processes as a report finds a diverse workforce is needed to fill employment gaps.

title.children: Report finds clean energy transition requires diverse employees

image.altText: A close-up portrait of an elderly woman

props.synopsis: Aboriginal rights trailblazer Margaret Tucker is among a group of remarkable women being put in the spotlight in a bid to improve gender representation in Victoria's public art.

title.children: Victorian trailblazers to be immortalised with public artworks

image.altText: Frida Kahlo self-portrait of woman wearing a thorn necklace with a monkey on her shoulder.

props.synopsis: Some of Frida Kahlo's clothing was kept under lock and key for 50 years. Now, garments holding "little traces of her daily life" will be on display in regional Victoria.

title.children: Kahlo clothing exhibit goes beyond the 'face with the flower crown'

image.altText: Three young girls wearing hats and purple shirts stand arm in arm infront of a pen of cattle

props.synopsis: Millions of dollars changed hands at the historic calf sale but for those in attendance, it was about more than just money and cattle.

title.children: Mountain calf sales more than just good business for remote farmers

image.altText: Tom Campbell poses with a football at the MCG after signing with Melbourne

props.synopsis: They're the backbone of every sporting team, the bench players who spend months or even years waiting to get their moment in the spotlight.

title.children: Here's to bench warmers, the unsung heroes of sporting teams

image.altText: Adam Kingsley and Craig McRae speak to each other near the benches after a game

props.synopsis: Collingwood's Craig McRae escapes sanction from the AFL over his sarcastic jibe at a GWS player that led to a heated exchange with rival coach Adam Kingsley.

title.children: Collingwood's McRae warned by AFL after sideline exchange with rival coach

image.altText: Chris Goulding holds the ball for Melbourne United against Illawarra Hawks in NBL grand final series.

props.synopsis: Chris Goulding and Matthew Dellavedova catch fire late to guide Melbourne United to an upset 96-88 win over Illawarra Hawks in Wollongong.

title.children: Goulding to the rescue as United stuns Hawks in NBL grand final opener

image.altText: Man tackling youth to floor of plane

props.synopsis: Shearing contractor Barry Clark arrived in Sydney on Friday to cheers from Jetstar staff, thanking him for his quick actions to subdue a 17-year-old who allegedly had a shotgun.

title.children: Shearer who tackled alleged gun-wielding teen gets hero's welcome

image.altText: A shitless young man and two young women with long hair stand in a rural area on a clear day.

props.synopsis: The festival is the biggest event on the calendar for the town of Donald, but after a late cancellation the blame game is underway.

title.children: Esoteric Festival cancellation leaves thousands stranded in tiny town

image.altText: Road sign towards Avalon airport and precinct with car driving past.

props.synopsis: Police say a teenager allegedly entered Avalon Airport through a hole in the security fence before he boarded a Jetstar flight armed with a loaded shotgun.

title.children: Security at regional airports under microscope after major security breach

image.altText: Benjamin Klein inside the Adass Israel Synagogue, standing in a room surrounded with fire-damaged walls.

props.synopsis: In the months after the December attack that devastated Melbourne's Jewish community, the synagogue's congregation has rallied, finding a makeshift place to pray and fundraising for the eventual rebuild of the site.

title.children: Melbourne synagogue congregation plans rebuild while waiting for justice

image.altText: A young basketballer on court, smiling

props.synopsis: Alier Riak's parents have remembered their son as a talented basketballer and role model for children.

title.children: Brothers jailed for 25 years for fatal stabbing of young basketballer in Melbourne

image.altText: a dilapidated pool with brown water sits in disrepair

props.synopsis: More than half of the state's municipal pools are over 50 years old and reaching their end of life, and councils warn more help is needed to keep them afloat.

title.children: More than half of Victoria's old public pools in danger of closing

image.altText: Jimmy Sing and Beci Orpin having a drink in her studio garden, with a brick graffiti wall and flowers behind them.

props.synopsis: A weed-filled rental garden became a thriving field of flowers in this transformation by friends Beci Orpin and Jimmy Sing.

title.children: Transforming a weed-filled rental garden into a thriving urban meadow

image.altText: An internal view of the Metro Tunnel.

props.synopsis: Two CFMEU delegates have been sacked amid allegations a labour hire company paid wages for shifts that were never worked in a scam that could potentially have cost millions of dollars.

title.children: Investigation into alleged Melbourne Metro Tunnel 'ghost shifts' scam

image.altText: A man gives a cow lying on the ground a drink of water from a water bottle.

props.synopsis: Dead and injured cattle from an overturned livestock truck were ignored by authorities for weeks while multiple state government agencies, councils, and insurance companies bickered over who was responsible.

title.children: Response to cattle truck rollover branded a bureaucratic 'balls-up'

image.altText: Judy Ann-Thomas standing in front flowers at her florist in Cheltenham.

props.synopsis: Some Cheltenham residents say 18-storey apartment buildings around future Suburban Rail Loop stations will change the character of their quiet neighbourhood, but traders say they'd welcome the boost to business.

title.children: In this Melbourne 'village', views are split on a high-rise future
